CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in PERSON , GPE . Their previous application ( no . CARDINAL ) was declared inadmissible by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . Seeking judicial review and compensation for damages on account of administrative decisions taken in a protracted dispute over their licence to sell folk - art items on public LOC , the applicants brought an action on DATE against the Sopron ORG ( “ the DATE action ” ) . The action was first registered at ORG , which on DATE issued an order for the completion of the file . The applicants complied with this order on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the action , holding that it had no competence to hear the case . On DATE the applicants appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Győr - Moson - Sopron County Regional Court quashed ORG decision . It transferred the case - file to its own competent bench .

CARDINAL . NORP In the proceedings before ORG , on DATE and CARDINAL DATE orders were issued for the completion of the file . The applicants complied with these orders on DATE and DATE , respectively . On DATE the defendant authority was eventually notified of the action .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE , the applicants brought an official liability action in the context of the above - mentioned proceedings before ORG ( “ the DATE action ” ) . The defendant authority was notified of this action on DATE . On DATE ORG held a hearing and , on DATE , it transferred the case - file to ORG for reasons of competence .

CARDINAL . Following a hearing held on DATE , ORG on DATE discontinued the proceedings concerning the applicants ' DATE action . ORG observed that the defendant authority had been notified earlier of the DATE action and , for that reason , the applicants ' claims were to be pursued in the proceedings relating to the latter action . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG , which , on DATE , upheld the decision to discontinue the proceedings on the DATE action .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , following repeated exchanges of observations between the parties in the proceedings concerning the DATE action , ORG held hearings on DATE and DATE . Another hearing was scheduled for DATE . In the context of procedural disputes concerning the applicants ' motion to hear certain witnesses , their obligation to pay outstanding stamp duties , as well as questions of legal aid , on DATE ORG decided the applicants ' procedural appeals .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicants compensation in a total amount of MONEY ( “ ORG ” ) , plus accrued interest . ORG dismissed the remainder of their claims . Having reviewed numerous related administrative files and decisions , ORG ruled that the defendant authority 's conduct had hindered the applicants in the exercise of their rights derived from their licence to trade on public LOC . In reasoning its CARDINAL - page decision , ORG relied on documentary evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed . On DATE they supplemented their appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , acting as a second instance jurisdiction , held a hearing . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
